trailingComments.value:
*
 Collection provides a standardized way to manipulate items in a component.
we create an unique collection identifier

leadingComments.value: we create an unique collection identifier

trailingComments.value: the container where the new items are added

leadingComments.value: the container where the new items are added

trailingComments.value: internal variable to determine if collection events will be handled internally

leadingComments.value: internal variable to determine if collection events will be handled internally

trailingComments.value: we provide support for the :scope selector and swap it for an id
we create a special selector to make sure that the items are direct children of the container. given that
:scope is not fully supported by all browsers, we use an id to query

leadingComments.value: we create a special selector to make sure that the items are direct children of the container. given that
:scope is not fully supported by all browsers, we use an id to query

trailingComments.value: we remove the :scope from the selector to be able to use it to determine if the item matches the collection

trailingComments.value: in case they match, we enable this optimization

leadingComments.value: in case they match, we enable this optimization

trailingComments.value: live collections are not supported when nested items is used
live collections can only be used when a tagname is used to query the items

creates an instance of an item from the object

container and itemtagname are the minimum options that need to be provided to automatically handle this function

arguments.value: Please provide host and itemTagName or override add() to provide your own implementation.

leadingComments.value: instead of querying the DOM, we just convert the live collection to an array, this way we obtain a
"snapshot" of the DOM
in order to perform the automatic getAll query, the _host and _allItemsSelector must be provided

Use getAll() so filter() is applied
Use getAll() so filter() is applied
this is an optimization to avoid using matches
Only element nodes are allowed
if options.onItemAdded was provided, we call the function

trailingComments.value: the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component

leadingComments.value: the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component
if options.onItemRemoved was provided, we call the function

trailingComments.value: the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component

leadingComments.value: the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component

trailingComments.value: * Enables the automatic detection of collection items. The collection will take care of triggering the appropriate collection event when an item is added or removed, as well the related callbacks. Components can decide to skip the initialization of the starting items by providing skipInitialItems as false. @param {Boolean} [skipInitialItems=false] If true, onItemAdded will be called for every starting item. A collection event will not be triggered for these items. @protected

leadingComments.value: we reuse the observer if it already exists, this way we do not need to disconnect it if this function is called
again

trailingComments.value: this changes the way that _onItemAdded and _onItemRemoved behave, since they well be delayed until a mutation
detects them

leadingComments.value: this changes the way that _onItemAdded and _onItemRemoved behave, since they well be delayed until a mutation
detects them
we only need to observe for items that were added and removed, no need to check attributes and contents
we need to listen to subtree mutations as items may not be direct children

trailingComments.value: by default we handle the initial items unless otherwise indicated

leadingComments.value: since we are handling the items for the component, we need to make sure the _onItemAdded is called for the
initial items. collection events will not be triggered for these items as they represent the initial state

trailingComments.value: we only call the _onCollectionChange callback if there are items inside the collection

leadingComments.value: we only call the _onCollectionChange callback if there are items inside the collection
by default we handle the initial items unless otherwise indicated

extra.rawValue: Please provide options.host and/or options.container to enable handling the items.
extra.raw: 'Please provide options.host and/or options.container to enable handling the items.'

arguments.value: Please provide options.host and/or options.container to enable handling the items.

leadingComments.value: * Enables the automatic detection of collection items. Components can decide to skip the initialization of the starting items by providing skipInitialItems as false. @param {Boolean} [skipInitialItems=false] If true, onItemAdded will be called for every starting item. A collection event will not be triggered for these items. @protected

trailingComments.value: * Handles every time that an element is added or removed from the options.container. By default the collection events will be triggered. If options.onItemAdded or options.onItemRemoved were provided, they will be called where it applies. @param Array.
we need to count every addition and removal to notify the component that the collection changed

trailingComments.value: if changes were done to the collection we need to notify the component. we do this after all the mutations were
processed to make sure we only do it once

* Handles every time that an element is added or removed from the options.container. By default the collection events will be triggered. If options.onItemAdded or options.onItemRemoved were provided, they will be called where it applies. @param Array.

comments.value:
*
 * Copyright 2019 Adobe. All rights reserved.
 * This file is licensed to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
 * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy
 * of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
 *
 * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under
 * the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS
 * OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language
 * governing permissions and limitations under the License.
* @private

*
 Collection provides a standardized way to manipulate items in a component.
we create an unique collection identifier
the container where the new items are added
internal variable to determine if collection events will be handled internally
we provide support for the :scope selector and swap it for an id
we create a special selector to make sure that the items are direct children of the container. given that
:scope is not fully supported by all browsers, we use an id to query
we remove the :scope from the selector to be able to use it to determine if the item matches the collection
in case they match, we enable this optimization
live collections are not supported when nested items is used
live collections can only be used when a tagname is used to query the items
container and itemtagname are the minimum options that need to be provided to automatically handle this function
creates an instance of an item from the object
inserts the element in the specified container
when items are handled automatically there is no need to call this immediately
in order to perform the automatic getAll query, the _host and _allItemsSelector must be provided
instead of querying the DOM, we just convert the live collection to an array, this way we obtain a
"snapshot" of the DOM
when items are handled automatically there is no need to call this immediatelly
Use getAll() so filter() is applied
Use getAll() so filter() is applied
Only element nodes are allowed
this is an optimization to avoid using matches
if options.onItemAdded was provided, we call the function
the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component
if options.onItemRemoved was provided, we call the function
the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component

* Enables the automatic detection of collection items. The collection will take care of triggering the appropriate collection event when an item is added or removed, as well the related callbacks. Components can decide to skip the initialization of the starting items by providing skipInitialItems as false. @param {Boolean} [skipInitialItems=false] If true, onItemAdded will be called for every starting item. A collection event will not be triggered for these items. @protected
we reuse the observer if it already exists, this way we do not need to disconnect it if this function is called
again
this changes the way that _onItemAdded and _onItemRemoved behave, since they well be delayed until a mutation
detects them
we only need to observe for items that were added and removed, no need to check attributes and contents
we need to listen to subtree mutations as items may not be direct children
by default we handle the initial items unless otherwise indicated
since we are handling the items for the component, we need to make sure the _onItemAdded is called for the
initial items. collection events will not be triggered for these items as they represent the initial state
we only call the _onCollectionChange callback if there are items inside the collection

* Handles every time that an element is added or removed from the options.container. By default the collection events will be triggered. If options.onItemAdded or options.onItemRemoved were provided, they will be called where it applies. @param Array.
we need to count every addition and removal to notify the component that the collection changed
filters the item
filters the item
if changes were done to the collection we need to notify the component. we do this after all the mutations were
processed to make sure we only do it once

 * OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language
 * governing permissions and limitations under the License.

*
 Collection provides a standardized way to manipulate items in a component.
we create an unique collection identifier
the container where the new items are added
internal variable to determine if collection events will be handled internally
we provide support for the :scope selector and swap it for an id
we create a special selector to make sure that the items are direct children of the container. given that
:scope is not fully supported by all browsers, we use an id to query
we remove the :scope from the selector to be able to use it to determine if the item matches the collection
in case they match, we enable this optimization
live collections are not supported when nested items is used
live collections can only be used when a tagname is used to query the items
container and itemtagname are the minimum options that need to be provided to automatically handle this function
creates an instance of an item from the object
inserts the element in the specified container
when items are handled automatically there is no need to call this immediately
Please provide host and itemTagName or override add() to provide your own implementation.
in order to perform the automatic getAll query, the _host and _allItemsSelector must be provided
instead of querying the DOM, we just convert the live collection to an array, this way we obtain a
Please provide host and itemTagName or override getAll() to provide your own implementation.
when items are handled automatically there is no need to call this immediatelly
Use getAll() so filter() is applied
Use getAll() so filter() is applied
this is an optimization to avoid using matches
if options.onItemAdded was provided, we call the function
the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component
if options.onItemRemoved was provided, we call the function
the usage of trigger assumes that the host is a coral component

* Enables the automatic detection of collection items. The collection will take care of triggering the appropriate collection event when an item is added or removed, as well the related callbacks. Components can decide to skip the initialization of the starting items by providing skipInitialItems as false. @param {Boolean} [skipInitialItems=false] If true, onItemAdded will be called for every starting item. A collection event will not be triggered for these items. @protected
we reuse the observer if it already exists, this way we do not need to disconnect it if this function is called
this changes the way that _onItemAdded and _onItemRemoved behave, since they well be delayed until a mutation
we only need to observe for items that were added and removed, no need to check attributes and contents
we need to listen to subtree mutations as items may not be direct children
by default we handle the initial items unless otherwise indicated
since we are handling the items for the component, we need to make sure the _onItemAdded is called for the
initial items. collection events will not be triggered for these items as they represent the initial state
we only call the _onCollectionChange callback if there are items inside the collection
Please provide options.host and/or options.container to enable handling the items.

* Handles every time that an element is added or removed from the options.container. By default the collection events will be triggered. If options.onItemAdded or options.onItemRemoved were provided, they will be called where it applies. @param Array.
we need to count every addition and removal to notify the component that the collection changed
if changes were done to the collection we need to notify the component. we do this after all the mutations were
processed to make sure we only do it once
